metadata.title: CVE-2011-3878 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
Race condition in Google Chrome before 15.0.874.102 allows remote attackersto cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact viavectors related to worker process initialization.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-3878` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 15.0.874.102~r106587-0ubuntu1
chromium-browser-l10n - 15.0.874.102~r106587-0ubuntu1
chromium-chromedriver - 15.0.874.102~r106587-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 15.0.874.102~r106587-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 15.0.874.102~r106587-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-3.0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
gir1.2-webkit-3.0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
gir1.2-webkit2-3.0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libjavascriptcoregtk-1.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libjavascriptcoregtk-3.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libjavascriptcoregtk-3.0-bin - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkit2gtk-3.0-25 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-1.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-1.0-common - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-3.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-3.0-common - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '15.0.874.102~r106587-0ubuntu1').
webkitgtk package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.9-2ubuntu2').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
